Two pretty charts showing ugly Bears data. Since Matt Nagy took over his offense has been a bottom 10 unit in both pass/rush EPA. 

It's time for an upgrade

@CowboysStats @adriancm93 Wow @CowboysStats might be the biggest Mike McCarthy fan in the #nflverse

Through 4 weeks, the worst performing QB in the AFC North has been Ben Roethlisberger, and by a wide margin. Burrow, Jackson, and Mayfield have put together a body of impressive work despite some hiccups here and there. #nflverse https://t.co/wAcQF6dT8Q

Some progress here for the #Steelers on their first down play calls yesterday. Averaged a gain of 4.4 yards. 5 of a possible 25 plays were for either no gain or negative yardage. 10 runs, 15 pass. 
Avg. EPA on runs: .00672
Avg. EPA on pass: -.027
#nflverse https://t.co/R9yBGw15ap

#Steelers had a marked improvement in running the ball against the #Packers yesterday. Best run came through the ends, but most attempts seemed to be behind the guards. #nflverse https://t.co/xVlanGK7Lc

The KFL analytics blog is up! https://t.co/0FViih9CKE

Check out the full write up on expected wins and luck in the KFL. I'll tweet some interesting findings over the next couple days. Data tables to search and a year by year review using expected wins. #ffverse #KFL #nflverse

The NE offense has lost nearly an entire win worth of win probability on turnovers, almost 20 percentage points more than any Pats team through four weeks in the #nflverse era.

We're through Week 4 and the model has finally learned that the @steelers are probably awful üò¢ 

Full season proj are in line with other systems, but my model doesn't love the @BuffaloBills, with slightly more than half the prob of a SB win compared to @FiveThirtyEight #nflverse https://t.co/2zq0HR3AuR https://t.co/l40Cs2XFNx

On a weekly projection level, the model did a nice job of picking winners last week, though it was overconfident on the wrong games - looking at you @MiamiDolphins, and I need to revisit the weight of pre-season team strength estimates, but here are this week's picks #nflverse https://t.co/MZA3QYfHo8
Last but not least, team strength estimates #nflverse https://t.co/o1YfVEfDiF

How well can we predict efficiency in any future in-season game based on what we know as of Game X?

Excluding Off Pass EPA/p, predicting a team's efficiency in their next game is often just as hard as predicting a game that is more than a month away.
